comments.content: "In your object management settings, create a lookup relationship between any standard or custom object and Opportunity Product (the OpportunityLineItem object). Make sure that the lookup field and related list are added to the page layouts where you want them to appear."

discussion.content: any body pls explain what is "locale" settings

Selected Answer: A
The User Locale setting affects the format of
Calendar
Number fields
Date/Time
Locale setting also tells what is the preferred language

questions.question_text: Locale settings control how users view date formats, time formats and number formats.

discussion.content: The clue in question is the term 'closely linked' which is used to describe M-D relationships.
The question also says there should always be a value required for oppty in the shipment page. This looks like cross object formula?

comments.content: A relationship is always created on the child object , since Shipment is the child object here I think answer B is correct.

master is oppurtunity. in this answer it shows as master-detail (shipping- Oppurtunity).
i think option should be D

discussion.content: Closely links objects together such that the master record controls certain behaviors of the detail and subdetail record.

questions.question_text: The system administrator has been asked to create a way to track Shipments of products to customers. Shipments should be closely tied to the Opportunity record and there may be more than one shipment record per Opportunity and the Opportunity should be required (i.e. Users cannot save a Shipment record without associating it to an Opportunity). The system administrator should create.

choices.A: A cross object formula displaying Opportunity ID on the Shipment record
choices.C: A lookup relationship on the Opportunity object to the Shipment object
choices.B: A Master - Detail relationship on the Shipment object to the Opportunity object
choices.D: A lookup relationship with a lookup filter from Opportunity to Shipment
